content.description:
Good crimpers lead to balancy clips and a good ledge to rest on before a big move at the finish.

This route is well protected and fun.
content.location:
The line second-from-right next to the left-facing corner on the uphill part of

The Cooler

.

content.description:
Relatively easy moves get you to a ledge, after which you climb to the right of the bolt line, up and over a somewhat worrisome Spire. Pull past the mild bulge on obvious and some not so obvious crimps to Finish on another ledge and casually clip the chains.

(The bolt line wanders a bit due to hollow rock but doesn't cause any drag)
content.location: Left most route, on the larger of the two walls. Left of Grins, Giggles, Smiles, and Laughs

content.description:
Enjoy initially desperate feet through the thin, crimpy, and occasionally crumbly start and head up dead vertical rock for the first thirty feet. Arrive at a narrow ledge and do your best to figure out an elegant way onto the ledge.

Above the ledge the angle eases a bit and the holds aren't quite so desperate. After the last bolt trend a bit right to the chains.
content.location:
On the larger, downhill wall at

The Cooler

is a relatively smooth, gray section approximately in the middle of the wall. This line climbs to the right of the smooth area past a ledge  about 30 feet up.

content.description:
Right up the left side of the tallest slab at the cooler. Relatively moderate but technical climbing leads to a really thin upper slab. The crimps are there but they are

really

small.
content.location:
The right-most (most downhill) line at

The Cooler

.

content.description: A steep beginning leads to some reachy moves.
content.location:
The line next to the left-facing corner on the uphill part of

The Cooler

.

content.description: More fun than the 10a with nice side pulls, a pocket or two and a few reachy sections.
content.location: The bolted line with two large, oblong pockets to the left of the bolt line near the first and second bolts. Second line from the left.

content.description: Continuous crimpers with pretty long distances between clips. It's not quite run out but make sure your belayers paying attention.
content.location:
The left-most line at

The Cooler

.
